verses.verse: <S%H4194>Dead<s%> <S%H2070>flies<s%> make a perfumer's <S%H8081>oil<s%> <S%H887>stink,<s%> so a <S%H4592>little<s%> <S%H5531>foolishness<s%> is <S%H3368>weightier<s%> <S%H4480>than<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> [and] <S%H9202>honor.<s%>
A <S%H2450>wise<s%> man's <S%H3820>heart<s%> [directs him] toward the <S%H3225>right,<s%> but the <S%H3684>foolish<s%> man's <S%H3820>heart<s%> [directs him] toward the <S%H8040>left.<s%>

<S%H1571>Even<s%> <S%H7945>when<s%> the <S%H5530>fool<s%> <S%H1980>walks<s%> along the <S%H1870>road<s%> his <S%H3820>sense<s%> is <S%H2637>lacking,<s%> and he <S%H559>demonstrates<s%> to <S%H3605>everyone<s%> [that] he is a <S%H5530>fool.<s%>

<S%H518>If<s%> the ruler's <S%H7307>temper<s%> <S%H5927>rises<s%> <S%H5921>against<s%> you, do not <S%H5117>abandon<s%> your <S%H4725>position,<s%> <S%H3588>because<s%> <S%H4832>composure<s%> <S%H5117>allays<s%> <S%H1419>great<s%> <S%H2399>offenses.<s%>

<S%H3426>There<s%> is an <S%H9567>evil<s%> I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> <S%H8478>under<s%> the <S%H8121>sun,<s%> like an <S%H7684>error<s%> <S%H7945>which<s%> <S%H3318>goes<s%> <S%H3318>forth<s%> from the <S%H7989>ruler<s%> –

<S%H5529>folly<s%> is <S%H5414>set<s%> in <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H4791>exalted<s%> <S%H4791>places<s%> while <S%H6223>rich<s%> <S%H6223>men<s%> <S%H3427>sit<s%> in <S%H8216>humble<s%> <S%H8216>places.<s%>
I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> <S%H5650>slaves<s%> [riding] on <S%H5483>horses<s%> and <S%H8269>princes<s%> <S%H1980>walking<s%> like <S%H5650>slaves<s%> on the <S%H776>land.<s%>
He who <S%H2658>digs<s%> a <S%H1475>pit<s%> may <S%H5307>fall<s%> into it, and a <S%H5175>serpent<s%> may <S%H5391>bite<s%> him who <S%H6555>breaks<s%> <S%H6555>through<s%> a <S%H1447>wall.<s%>
He who <S%H5265>quarries<s%> <S%H68>stones<s%> may be <S%H6087>hurt<s%> by them, and he who <S%H1234>splits<s%> <S%H6086>logs<s%> may be <S%H5533>endangered<s%> by them.

<S%H518>If<s%> the <S%H1270>axe<s%> is <S%H6949>dull<s%> and he does not <S%H7043>sharpen<s%> [its] <S%H6440>edge,<s%> then he must <S%H1396>exert<s%> more <S%H2428>strength.<s%> <S%H2451>Wisdom<s%> has the <S%H3504>advantage<s%> of <S%H3787>giving<s%> <S%H3787>success.<s%>
<S%H518>If<s%> the <S%H5175>serpent<s%> <S%H5391>bites<s%> before being <S%H3908>charmed,<s%> <S%H369>there<s%> is <S%H369>no<s%> <S%H3504>profit<s%> for the <S%H1167>charmer.<s%> <S%H3956><s%>
<S%H1697>Words<s%> from the <S%H6310>mouth<s%> of a <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H2450>man<s%> are <S%H2580>gracious,<s%> while the <S%H8193>lips<s%> of a <S%H3684>fool<s%> <S%H1104>consume<s%> him;
the <S%H8462>beginning<s%> of his <S%H1697>talking<s%> <S%H6310><s%> is <S%H5531>folly,<s%> and the <S%H319>end<s%> of it is <S%H9567>wicked<s%> <S%H1948>madness.<s%>

Yet the <S%H5530>fool<s%> <S%H7235>multiplies<s%> <S%H1697>words.<s%> <S%H3808>No<s%> <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H3045>knows<s%> <S%H4100>what<s%> will <S%H1961>happen,<s%> and <S%H4310>who<s%> can <S%H5046>tell<s%> him <S%H834>what<s%> will <S%H1961>come<s%> <S%H4480>after<s%> <S%H310><s%> him?
The <S%H5999>toil<s%> of a <S%H3684>fool<s%> [so] <S%H3021>wearies<s%> him that he does not [even] <S%H3045>know<s%> how to <S%H1980>go<s%> to a <S%H5892>city.<s%>
<S%H337>Woe<s%> to you, O <S%H776>land,<s%> <S%H7945>whose<s%> <S%H4428>king<s%> is a <S%H5288>lad<s%> and whose <S%H8269>princes<s%> <S%H398>feast<s%> in the <S%H1242>morning.<s%>

<S%H835>Blessed<s%> are you, O <S%H776>land,<s%> <S%H7945>whose<s%> <S%H4428>king<s%> is of <S%H1121>nobility<s%> <S%H2715><s%> and whose <S%H8269>princes<s%> <S%H398>eat<s%> at the appropriate <S%H6256>time<s%> – for <S%H1369>strength,<s%> and not for <S%H8358>drunkenness.<s%>
Through <S%H6103>indolence<s%> the <S%H4746>rafters<s%> <S%H4355>sag,<s%> and through <S%H8220>slackness<s%> <S%H3027><s%> the <S%H1004>house<s%> <S%H1811>leaks.<s%>

[Men] <S%H6213>prepare<s%> a <S%H3899>meal<s%> for <S%H7814>enjoyment,<s%> and <S%H3196>wine<s%> <S%H8055>makes<s%> <S%H9132>life<s%> <S%H8055>merry,<s%> and <S%H3701>money<s%> is the <S%H6030>answer<s%> to <S%H3605>everything.<s%>

<S%H1571>Furthermore,<s%> in your <S%H4093>bedchamber<s%> do not <S%H7043>curse<s%> a <S%H4428>king,<s%> and in your <S%H4904>sleeping<s%> <S%H2315>rooms<s%> do not <S%H7043>curse<s%> a <S%H6223>rich<s%> <S%H6223>man,<s%> for a <S%H5775>bird<s%> of the <S%H8064>heavens<s%> will <S%H1980>carry<s%> the <S%H6963>sound,<s%> and the <S%H3671>winged<s%> creature will <S%H5046>make<s%> the <S%H1697>matter<s%> <S%H5046>known.<s%>
